intro: Securidaca acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved devil's-bit. It is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. It typically grows in open woodlands and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
